intro: Hydrolea extra-axillaris, commonly known as the extra-axillary hydrolea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often hairy, with a distinctive shape. Hydrolea extra-axillaris is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
